00:00:01:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:01:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you're wrong. Wolverine was not born with bone claws.

00:00:06:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:06:000000.Dialogue: Howard, you know me to be a very smart man. Don't you think if I were wrong, I'd know it?

00:00:11:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:11:130000.Dialogue: Give it up, dude. You're arguing with a crazy person.

00:00:16:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:16:010000.Dialogue: I'm not crazy. My mother had me tested.

00:00:20:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:20:140000.Dialogue: Hey, guys. What are you doing here? What do you mean? It's new comic book night.

00:00:24:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:24:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, but since you and Penny finally hooked up, we thought you two would be having bouncy naked yum-yum night.

00:00:30:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:30:030000.Dialogue: There's more to life than sex, Raj.

00:00:33:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:33:030000.Dialogue: Okay, who had "Leonard flames out with Penny - in less than 24 hours"?

00:00:37:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:37:150000.Dialogue: Nothing flamed out. We don't have to have sex every night, you know.

00:00:41:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:41:040000.Dialogue: You don't have to, but it's highly recommended.

00:00:45:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:45:040000.Dialogue: Yeah, take advantage of that window of opportunity before it slams shut on your little dinky.

00:00:50:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:50:170000.Dialogue: It's not a matter of opportunity. We're getting to know each other. There's a learning curve.

00:00:55:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:55:170000.Dialogue: What's there to learn? You get naked, do nasty things to each other, then somebody makes scrambled eggs and salami. Easy peasy.

00:01:01:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:060000.Dialogue: Perhaps what Leonard is obliquely referring to is the occurrence of some sort of sexual dysfunction.

00:01:06:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:06:180000.Dialogue: Okay, who had "Leonard gets a floppy disk"?

00:01:10:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:10:060000.Dialogue: Oh, a clever-- albeit obsolete, euphemism for insufficient blood flow to the male sex organ.

00:01:17:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:17:190000.Dialogue: Nothing like that happened, all right? The sex was... just fine.

00:01:21:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:21:200000.Dialogue: Just fine? Oh, dude, the fourth Harry Potter movie was "just fine."

00:01:28:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:28:080000.Dialogue: I'm not saying it was bad. I'm just saying it... wasn't great.

00:01:32:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:32:210000.Dialogue: Okay, when you say "it wasn't great," do you mean for both of you? Because we can totally see it not being great for her. Am I right?

00:01:38:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:38:210000.Dialogue: To tell you the truth, I think we were both a little-- I don't know...

00:01:45:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:45:220000.Dialogue: All I know is, it wasn't the wa y I dreamed it would be.

00:01:49:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:49:100000.Dialogue: (scoffs) Sex is never the way Idream it's gonna be.

00:01:56:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:56:110000.Dialogue: Because in your dreams you're a horse from the waist down.

00:01:59:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:59:230000.Dialogue: Excuse me, Wolverine: Origin. Miniseries issue two, page 22. Retractable bone claws. If you people spent less time thinking about sex and more time concentrating on comic books, we'd have far fewer of these embarrassing moments.

00:02:49:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:49:030000.Dialogue: You're good-naturedly ribbing me, aren't you?

00:02:54:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:54:030000.Dialogue: Why? Why would we change? We had a perfectly good palace. Tandoori Palace is our palace.

00:03:01:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:01:160000.Dialogue: Trust me, this will be just fine.

00:03:04:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:04:040000.Dialogue: You are the authority on "just fine." (snickering)

00:03:22:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:22:170000.Dialogue: If that's Morse code, that's terrible.

00:03:26:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:26:170000.Dialogue: As I was saying, you and Leonard had sexual encounter. a disap pointing Earlier this evening, Leonard characterized it as "just fine." So what you're seeing here is a continuation of the mocking that followed.

00:03:39:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:39:060000.Dialogue: Okay, yeah, well, I'm just gonna go eat my dinner elsewhere. Maybe an airplane headed for a mountainside.

00:03:45:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:45:190000.Dialogue: Penny, wait. Aah! What is wrong with you?

00:03:54:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:54:190000.Dialogue: I sense I may have crossed some sort of line.

00:04:12:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:12:200000.Dialogue: Nothing bad, just that last night was fine.

00:04:15:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:15:200000.Dialogue: Fine? You said it was fine?

00:04:18:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:18:090000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's a perfectly good word. You put it in front of "wine" or "dining," and you've really got something .

00:04:27:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:27:210000.Dialogue: Okay, well, let me ask you this: How was last night for you?

00:04:38:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:38:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's a perfectly good word. I mean, you put it in front of "dokay" and you really got something.

00:04:46:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:46:220000.Dialogue: All right, look, let's not overreact, you know? For a lot of couples, it takes time to get to know each other's rhythms. Learn what the other person wants and likes.

00:04:52:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:52:230000.Dialogue: So, you've been through this before?

00:05:01:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:01:110000.Dialogue: You know, I think this is one of those things where talking about it is not going to make it better. Want a glass of wine?

00:05:06:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:06:230000.Dialogue: Okay. See, we should've done this last night. You know, have a little wine, take the edge off.

00:05:14:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:14:000000.Dialogue: Actually, ethyl alcohol inhibits electrical conduction in the nerve cells and stimulates reuptake receptors of inhibitory neurotransmitters like gamma-aminobutyric acid.

00:05:32:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:32:010000.Dialogue: No, you're misunderstanding A shiksa goddess isn't an actual goddess And we don't pray to them. We prey on them.

00:05:42:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:42:140000.Dialogue: Whatever, dude. The point is, Leonard's got one and you don't.

00:05:47:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:47:020000.Dialogue: Is this it? It was inappropriate to discuss Leonard and Penny's sex life in front of Leonard and Penny. Oh, good!

00:06:14:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:14:160000.Dialogue: Based on the number of chirps per minute and the ambient temperature in this room, it is a snowy tree cricket.

00:06:21:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:21:040000.Dialogue: Oh, give me a freakin' break. How could you possibly know that?

00:06:25:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:25:170000.Dialogue: In 1890, Emile Dolbear determined that there was a fixed relationship between the number of chirps per minute of the snowy tree cricket and the ambient temperature. A precise relationship that is not present with ordinary field crickets.

00:06:36:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:36:170000.Dialogue: How do you know what the exact temperature of the room is?

00:06:39:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:39:060000.Dialogue: Under the terms of my roommate agreement with Leonard, I've had unilateral control of the thermostat ever since the sweaty night of '06.

00:06:45:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:45:180000.Dialogue: Okay, you were right about wolverine and bone claws, but you're wrong about the cricket.

00:06:52:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:52:180000.Dialogue: Howard, don't embarrass yourself. The science chirps for itself. (chuckling): Humorous word play.

00:07:00:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:00:070000.Dialogue: No, no, not this time. I know insects, my friend. I spent many childhood years capturing them with nets, putting them in glass jars, sticking pins through them, mounting them on corrugated cardboard with Dymo labels underneath, identifying the genus and species. In Latin.

00:07:18:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:18:080000.Dialogue: Oh, dude, you are never getting a shiksa goddess.

00:07:24:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:24:210000.Dialogue: Thatis a snowy tree cricket. Oecanthus fultoni. I was done with Latin by fifth grade.

00:07:31:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:31:210000.Dialogue: Okay, okay, tell you what. I am willing to bet anything that's an ordinary field cricket.

00:07:40:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:40:100000.Dialogue: I've always found that an inappropriate slur. Chickens are not, by nature, at all timid. In fact, when I was young, my neighbor's chicken got loose and chased me up the big elm tree in front of our house.

00:07:58:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:58:230000.Dialogue: Okay, I believe a chicken made you his bitch.

00:08:03:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:03:110000.Dialogue: But the cricket thing, I don't buy. Bet me.

00:08:06:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:06:110000.Dialogue: Fair enough. What stakedo you propose?

00:08:10:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:10:230000.Dialogue: I will put up my Fantastic Four number 48, first appearance of Silver Surfer against your Flash 123, the classicFlash of two worlds issue.

00:08:21:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:21:000000.Dialogue: All right, you have a wager.

00:08:40:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:40:010000.Dialogue: I wonder what the non-pathetic people are doing tonight.

00:08:56:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment, Penny and Leonard are kissing. They break and look at each other uncomfortably.
00:08:56:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:04:150000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:04:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:05:150000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:05:150000.Speaker: Howard

00:09:12:030000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:12:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:18:160000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:18:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:32:050000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:32:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:33:170000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:33:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:33:170000.Dialogue: My stomach. Indian food doesn't agree with me.

00:09:40:170000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:40:170000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:43:050000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:43:050000.Speaker: Howard

00:09:53:060000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:53:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:54:180000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:54:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:54:180000.Dialogue: Are you crazy? We can't go down an empty elevator shaft.

00:09:58:060000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:09:58:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:58:060000.Dialogue: Fine, if you don't want to proceed, then you forfeit the bet, and I'll take possession of your Fantastic Four.

00:10:04:070000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:10:04:070000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:07:190000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:10:07:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:07:190000.Dialogue: Are you bothered that I can so easily manipulate you?

00:10:10:190000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:10:10:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:10:190000.Dialogue: Don't push me, Sheldon. I may be small, but I took kung fu when I was 13, and I remember a good deal of it.

00:10:18:080000.Scene: The apartment, the guys are still searching for the cricket. They are inside the cupboard
00:10:18:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:18:080000.Dialogue: Oh, really? Well, I grew up with an older brother and a very contentious twin sister. And I believe I could easily best you in any physical confrontation-- be it noogies, swirlies or the classic "Why are you hitting yourself?"

00:10:31:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:31:200000.Dialogue: Ooh, big talk from a man who was once treed by a chicken.

00:10:50:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:50:100000.Dialogue: Why would you buy peppermint schnapps?

00:10:53:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:53:100000.Dialogue: Because I like peppermint, and it's fun to say schnapps.

00:11:05:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:05:230000.Dialogue: Schnapps. You're right , that is fun.

00:11:12:110000.Scene: The elevator shaft. Sheldon is inside.
00:11:12:110000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:14:230000.Scene: The elevator shaft. Sheldon is inside.
00:11:14:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:14:230000.Dialogue: SHELDON: If I were not being careful, your telling me to be careful would not ke me careful.

00:11:24:120000.Scene: The elevator shaft. Sheldon is inside.
00:11:24:120000.Speaker: Raj

00:11:27:000000.Scene: The elevator shaft. Sheldon is inside.
00:11:27:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:27:000000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Uh-oh, flashlight went out. I need some batteries. Fellas?

00:11:35:130000.Scene: The elevator shaft. Sheldon is inside.
00:11:35:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:39:130000.Scene: The elevator shaft. Sheldon is inside.
00:11:39:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:45:130000.Scene: Penny’s bathroom. Leonard is vomiting in the toilet.
00:11:45:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:45:130000.Dialogue: Oh, sweetie. You really can't hold your liquor, can you?

00:11:52:140000.Scene: Penny’s bathroom. Leonard is vomiting in the toilet.
00:11:52:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:52:140000.Dialogue: I'm okay. Just a little mouthwash, and then I'm gonna rock your world.

00:12:04:140000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:04:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:13:050000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:13:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:13:050000.Dialogue: Ugh, Toby, what did you do in a past life to be so disgusting now?

00:12:19:050000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:19:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:19:050000.Dialogue: His name isn't Toby Toby is an absurd name for a cricket.

00:12:23:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:23:170000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:24:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:24:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:24:170000.Dialogue: An appropriate cricket name. For example, Jiminy.

00:12:28:180000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:28:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:28:180000.Dialogue: All right, Sheldon, here we go. Kleingast's Field Guide to North American Insects. Hey, Toby. Right here. See it? The common field cricket, AKA Gryllus assimilis, which is Latin for "suck it, you lose."

00:12:44:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:44:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:44:070000.Dialogue: Hang on. Voil?. The snowy tree cricket. AKA Oecanthus fultoni, which is Latin for I'll suck nothing.

00:12:53:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:53:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:53:190000.Dialogue: Of course I'm joking because the Latin for that isnihil exsorbibo.

00:12:57:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:12:57:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:57:190000.Dialogue: That is not Toby, this is Toby. Raj, what do you think?

00:13:02:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:02:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:02:200000.Dialogue: Oh, I really don't care anymore

00:13:07:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:07:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:07:080000.Dialogue: God, I had the most horrible night.

00:13:09:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:09:200000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:11:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:11:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:11:080000.Dialogue: Obviously another carnal fiasco with the shiksi goddess.

00:13:15:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:15:080000.Speaker: Howard

00:13:17:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:17:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:17:080000.Dialogue: Forgive me. Yiddish was not spoken in east Texas. And if it was, it wasn't spoken for long.

00:13:24:210000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:24:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:24:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, fine, whatever. The point is, you're wrong again.

00:13:27:210000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:27:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:27:210000.Dialogue: We haven't established that I'm wrong once.

00:13:36:090000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:36:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:36:090000.Dialogue: SHELDON: He's a snow y tree cricket, and his name is Jiminy.

00:13:39:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Raj has the cricket in a jar.
00:13:39:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:39:100000.Dialogue: I bet I could throw a rock in this room and come up with three better friends.

00:13:58:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:58:230000.Dialogue: It's like Silence of the Lambs down here.

00:14:08:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:08:110000.Dialogue: You're such a girl. They're just bugs.

00:14:11:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:11:110000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, I don't like bugs, okay? They freak me out.

00:14:14:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:120000.Dialogue: Interesting. You're afraid of insects and women. Ladybugs must render you catatonic.

00:14:23:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:23:000000.Dialogue: It was a joke. I made it to lessen your discomfort. You're welcome

00:14:39:010000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:14:39:010000.Dialogue: Why be polite to the world's leading expert

00:14:44:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:44:010000.Dialogue: Excuse me, are you Professor Crawley?

00:14:49:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:49:140000.Dialogue: I'm Dr. Cooper from the Physics Department.

00:14:55:140000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:14:55:140000.Dialogue: I haven't even packed yet, and you're already measuring my lab for one of your godless laser machines.

00:15:03:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:03:020000.Dialogue: No, you don't understand. We just want to ask you a question.

00:15:07:030000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:15:07:030000.Dialogue: Let me ask you one first. What's a world renowned entomologist with a doctorate and 20 years of experience to do with his life when the university cuts off the funding for his lab, huh?

00:15:19:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:19:150000.Dialogue: Ask rhetorical questions that make people uncomfortable?

00:15:26:160000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:15:26:160000.Dialogue: What's your deal? Are they planning to outsource my job to Bangalore?

00:15:37:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:37:040000.Dialogue: Maybe you should find another entomologist.

00:15:39:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:39:040000.Dialogue: No, no. We're here. Let's settle this. Professor, can you identify our cricket?

00:15:43:170000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:15:43:170000.Dialogue: Of course I can. I can identify every insect and arachnid on the planet. Not that that's going to keep me from having to move in with my daughter in Oxnard. And we're not talking Oxnard at the beach. No! We're talking Oxnard in the onion fields.

00:16:04:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:04:180000.Dialogue: Well, could you look at Toby?

00:16:07:060000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:16:07:060000.Dialogue: Toby? What a stupid name for a cricket.

00:16:20:190000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:16:20:190000.Dialogue: Young man, I've been studying insects since I was eight years old. You know what they used to call me in school? Creepy Crawley.

00:16:29:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:29:070000.Dialogue: Cruel as that may be, that is not in itself a credential.

00:16:34:080000.Speaker: Prof Crawley
00:16:34:080000.Dialogue: Let me show you something. See that? That's a Crawley's dung beetle I discovered it after spending six months slogging through a Bornean rain forest, while my wife was back home shacking up with a two-bit ornithologist who lives on a sailboat and likes to wear boot-cut jeans! So, when I tell you that that's a common field cricket, you can take that to the damn bank! Cause God knows I can't

00:17:24:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:24:100000.Dialogue: Enjoy Oxnard. I'm sure your daughter's looking forward to having you.

00:17:37:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:37:110000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, Sheldon. What you got there? A new comic book?

00:17:40:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:40:230000.Dialogue: Old comic book. I just retrieved it from my safe deposit box.

00:17:45:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:45:230000.Dialogue: What do you have a safe deposit box for?

00:17:48:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:48:230000.Dialogue: Old comic books. I lost this to Wolowitz

00:17:57:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:57:000000.Dialogue: What, do they have Wii cricket now?

00:18:03:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:03:130000.Dialogue: Penny, I'd rather not talk about it.

00:18:05:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:05:130000.Dialogue: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I'm not feeling so hot either.

00:18:10:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:10:010000.Dialogue: Why would that make me feel better?

00:18:19:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:19:010000.Dialogue: Anyway, I'm just saying, that you're feeling upset about something with Howard, and I'm upset about something with Leonard.

00:18:28:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:28:020000.Dialogue: That's an inexac t parallel. You and Leonard can always return to being friends, whereas I can never return to a state in which Wolowitz has not bested me like Mrs. Riley' s chicken.

00:18:41:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:41:030000.Dialogue: A chicken that was owned by Mrs. Riley.

00:18:49:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:49:030000.Dialogue: No, no. You may be right about me and Leonard.

00:18:52:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:52:150000.Dialogue: Of course I'm right What are the odds I'd be wrong twice in one week?

00:18:57:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:57:040000.Dialogue: No, I mean, we can always go back to being friends.

00:18:59:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:59:040000.Dialogue: I just said that. This conversation has started to circle. Meeting adjourned.

00:19:13:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:13:160000.Dialogue: Oh, you'd like to catch up on the events of the day. All right. Well, there was a half-hour wait at the bank to get into my safe deposit box, I was forced to talk to Penny about your sexual problems, and, oh, yes, in a moment filled with biblical resonance, pride wenteth before my fall, causing my Flash 123 to goeth to Wolowitz.

00:19:32:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:32:180000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. You talked to Penny about our sex life?

00:19:36:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:36:180000.Dialogue: Leonard, it astonishes me how you continually fixate on the trivial. I lost a bet to Wolowitz.

00:19:43:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:43:060000.Dialogue: Right, right. You're saying you talked to Penny?

00:19:51:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:51:070000.Dialogue: Have I crossed some sort of line again?

00:20:11:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:11:040000.Dialogue: Uh, what did Sheldon say to you?

00:20:12:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:12:160000.Dialogue: Not a lot. Just that we always have the option of going back to being friends.

00:20:19:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:19:010000.Dialogue: I don't know. I mean, you have to admit things seemed simpler when we were just friends.

00:20:26:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:26:110000.Dialogue: It would take the pressure off.
